item.title: summer61 add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: summer61 add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "The trouble with being in the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat." -- Lily Tomlin

item.title: summer61 add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: summer61 add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime." -- Mark Twain

item.title: summer61 add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: summer61 add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "I think having land and not ruining it is the most beautiful art that anybody could ever want." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: summer61 add a quote by Gerard Manley Hopkins
item.description: "What would the world be, once bereft Of wet and wildness? Let them be left, Oh let them be left, wildness and wet; Long live the weeds and the wilderness yet." -- Gerard Manley Hopkins

item.title: summer61 add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "Let us give Nature a chance; she knows her business better than we do." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: summer61 add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Out of the quarrel with others we make rhetoric; out of the quarrel with ourselves we make poetry." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: summer61 add a quote by Eleanor Hodgman Porter
item.description: "Be glad. Be good. Be brave." -- Eleanor Hodgman Porter
